Hotel search result cell > Verify elements: thumbnail, hotel name, guest rating, neighborhood/distance, price

custom.preconds: User has performed a search and the app has delivered results
custom.steps: 1. User looks at a hotel result cell
custom.expected: 1. At the left is a thumbnail image of the hotel or a placeholder image of a bed (if the hotel thumbnail has not yet downloaded) 2. To the right of the thumbnail is the main content of the cell: top line contains the hotel name (if it is too long for the cell, it is ellipsized not broken onto a second line) 3. Second line of the cell contains the guest rating (squares or numeric values depending on October 2015 AB test) 4. Third line of the cell contains the neighborhood or the distance (separate test case for this) 5. Far right of cell contains the price vertically centered and any urgency messaging and discount tags in the corner (separate test case for this)

case.title: Hotel search result cell > Verify Current Location search result cells show distance in miles or kilometres based on device region settings

custom.preconds: User has performed a Current Location search and delivered results.
custom.steps: 1. User looks at the hotel cells
custom.expected: 2. Hotel cells contain a distance which is localized into either miles or kilometres based on the device region setting (eg: US uses imperial, Germany uses metric)

custom.expected: 2. Cell contains a neighborhood description (eg:Las Vegas: East of The Strip, The Strip)

case.title: Hotel search result cell > Verify discount triangle tag appears in top right corner of cell and same percentage off is shown on hotel details and rooms & rates

custom.preconds: User has done a hotel search and delivered results
custom.steps: 1. User looks at the cell of a discounted rate hotel
custom.expected: 1. Discount tag appears in the top right corner of the cell in green. 2. Discount percentage is greater than 0% 3. Discount percentage shown on search results matches the discount shown on hotel details in the gallery ribbon 4. Discount percentage shown on search results matches the discount shown on rooms & rates

case.title: Hotel search result cell > Verify strikethrough prices appear on discounted hotels

custom.preconds: User must have entered the Hotels LOB and completed a search with results
custom.steps: 1. User looks at the price section of the cell on a discounted hotel 2. User selects the hotel and proceeds to hotel details
custom.expected: 1. The original higher price for the hotel appears with a strikethrough, the discounted price appears in bold. The strikethrough price must not be higher than the discounted price and the difference between the two prices must match the percentage off corner tag. 2. The same strikethrough price is visible at the bottom right of the gallery - all discount information is consistent between the two screens.

case.title: Proceed to Hotel Reviews screen > Verify Recent filter
Proceed to Hotel Reviews screen > Verify Favorable filter
Proceed to Hotel Reviews screen > Verify Critical filter
Proceed to Hotel Reviews screen > Verify total number of reviews between details and review screen
Proceed to Hotel Reviews screen > Verify long review description can expand
Proceed to Hotel Reviews screen > Verify when tap on "Back" button user lands on details screen
Hotel search > shop like a user would, select multiple hotels and read reviews before going to checkout

custom.preconds: Very often, we test like testers - for this test, try to behave as a user who really has to choose a good hotel at the right price would.
custom.steps: 1. Deliver search results for a city 2. Select a hotel, go to details and scroll to the bottom, back out to search results, repeat this process multiple times 3. Select a hotel, go to the reviews screen, change reviews tabs and scroll through a few reviews, back out to search results, repeat this process multiple times 4. Select a hotel, go to Rooms & Rates, select a rate and go to checkout, back out to Rooms & Rates and select a different rate, go to checkout, repeat this process multiple times.
custom.expected: 1. Search results appear for the correct city, which is reflected on the map view and the list view 2. No crashing should occur when user backs out, no slowness should be encountered, the hotel which was selected from search results should be the one you see on hotel details. 3. No unintended changing of guest(s) or dates should occur 4. Checkout should update for the rate of the selected room

step.content: I search for hotel in "Waikiki" with checkin date "two months from today" Then filter hotels by "Hilton Hawaiian Village" And I select "ETP Hilton Hawaiian Village Waikiki Beach" hotel from hotels list Then I tap on "Book Now, Pay Later" button
step.expected: And I land on "Book Now, Pay Later" page

step.content: Then I tap on "Select Room" button
step.expected: Then I expect to see "pay now pay later option" area on "rooms and rates"

step.content: Then "Pay Now" should be highlighted
step.expected: Then I expect to see rooms list And I confirm that "$0 Due now" price is not present on the rooms card

step.content: And I select 1st available room
step.expected: And I expect to see Fees Paid at Hotel to be more than "0.00" Then I expect to see Due to Expedia Today to be more than "0.00"

step.content: And I press on the Hotels Checkout button Then I press Log in for faster booking And I enter "qa-ehcc@mobiata.com" as account email with "3xp3d1acc" password
step.expected: And I expect to see Amount to be Paid Now to be more than "0.00"

section.name: Itineraries Local Notifications
section.description: Local notifications are derived from the device date and time plus the event start and end dates. These are not server-driven, as flight or Leanplum push notifications are.

case.title: Itineraries > Verify Car local notification fires when car can be picked up

custom.preconds: User must have made a rental car booking as a guest or as a logged in user. Car rental itinerary must be present on the device in the itineraries screen.
custom.steps: 1. Given I have a car rental, when the pickup time starts 2. If I dismiss the notification from inside or outside the EB app 3. If I tap [view] from inside or outside the app
custom.expected: 1. I will receive a notification that reads “You can now pick up your car from Enterprise.” 2. The notification goes away 3. I am taken to the itineraries screen and the relevant car itinerary card expands to allow me to view the details

case.title: Itineraries > Verify Car local notification fires 2 hours prior to the drop-off time

custom.preconds: User must have made a rental car booking as a guest or as a logged in user. Car rental itinerary must be present on the device in the itineraries screen.
custom.steps: 1. Given I have a car rental, when it is 2 hours prior to the return time 2. If I dismiss the notification inside or outside the Expedia app 3. If I tap [view] on the notification
custom.expected: 1. I receive a notification that reads “Your Enterprise rental car is due to be returned in two hours.” 2. The notification dismisses 3. I am taken to the EB app, itineraries screen and the relevant car booking card expands so I can view the details.

case.title: Itineraries > Verify Hotel local notification fires at 10am on check-in day

custom.preconds: User must have booked a hotel either as a guest or as a logged-in user, itinerary must be on the device in the trips screen.
custom.steps: 1. Given I have a hotel booking, when it is 10 AM on the check-in day (10am device time) 2. If I dismiss the notification from inside or outside the Expedia app 3. If I tap [view] on the notification from inside or outside the Expedia app
custom.expected: 1. I receive receive a notification that reads “Check in at <hotel name> begins at <check-in time> today.” (ex: “Check in at The Hyatt Regency Bellevue begins at 3PM today.”) 2. The notification dismisses 3. I am taken into the Itineraries screen to the relevant Hotel card which expands so I can see the details.

case.title: Itineraries > Verify Hotel local notification fires at 10am on check-out day

custom.preconds: User must have booked a hotel either as a guest or as a logged-in user, itinerary must be on the device in the trips screen.
custom.steps: 1. Given I have a hotel booking, when it is 10 AM on the check-out day (10am device time) 2. If I dismiss the notification from inside or outside the Expedia app 3. If I tap [view] on the notification from inside or outside the Expedia app
custom.expected: 1. I should receive a notification that reads “Check out at <hotel name> is at <check-out time> today.” (ex: “Check out at The Hyatt Regency Bellevue is at 11AM today.”) 2. The notification dismisses 3. I am taken into the Itineraries screen to the relevant Hotel card which expands so I can see the details.

case.title: Itineraries > Verify Activity local notification fires at 12pm on the day prior to the validity start date

custom.preconds: User must have booked an activity either as a guest or as a logged-in user, itinerary must be on the device in the trips screen.
custom.steps: 1. Given I have an activity booking, when it is 12pm (device time) on the day prior to the activity 2. If I dismiss the notification from inside or outside the Expedia app 3. If I tap [view] on the notification from inside or outside the Expedia app
custom.expected: 1. I should receive a notification that reads “Your <activity name> can be redeemed starting tomorrow.” (ex: “Your Universal Studios ticket can be redeemed starting tomorrow.”) 2. The notification dismisses 3. I am taken into the Itineraries screen to the relevant Activity card which expands so I can see the details.

case.title: Itineraries > Verify Flight local notification fires when I can check in for my flight or 24 hours before departure

custom.preconds:
User must have booked a flight either as a guest or as a logged-in user, itinerary must be loaded on the device in the trips screen.
Carrier Name; Carrier Code; Check-in Time (in hours) Air Canada; AC; 24 Air China; CA; 12 Air France; AF; 30 Air India; AI; 36 airberlin; AB; 30 AirTran; FL; 24 Alaska Airlines; AS; 24 Alitalia; AZ; 20 Allegiant; G4; 24 American Airlines; AA; 24 Austrian; OS; 24 Brussels Airlines; SN; 24 Cathay Pacific; CX; 24 China Airlines; CI; 24 China Southern; CZ; 24 Czech Airlines; OK; 24 Delta; DL; 24 EL AL; LY; 24 Emirates; EK; 24 Etihad; EY; 20 EVA Air; BR; 24 Finnair; AY; 36 Frontier; F9; 24 Germanwings; 4U; 24 go!; YV; 24 Hawaiian Airlines; HA; 24 Iberia; IB; 24 Icelandair; FI; 36 Indigo Airlines; 6E; 48 Island Air; WP; 24 JAL; JL; 24 Jet Airways; 9W; 48 JetBlue; B6; 24 Jetstar; JQ; 24 Kenya Airways; KQ; 30 LAN Airlines; LA; 48 LOT Polish Airlines; LO; 23 Lufthansa; LH; 23 Oman Air; WY; 24 OpenSkies; EC; 24 Porter; PD; 24 Qantas; QF; 24 Qatar Airways; QR; 36 Regional Express; ZL; 48 Royal Brunei; BI; 24 SAS; SK; 22 Singapore Airlines; SQ; 48 South African Airways;SA; 24 Southwest; WN; 24 SpiceJet; SG; 24 Spirit; NK; 24 Sun Country; SY; 24 TAM; JJ; 24 TAP Portugal; TP; 24 TUIfly; X3; 30 Turkish Airlines; TK; 24 United; UA; 24 US Airways; US; 24 Virgin America; VX; 24 Virgin Atlantic; VS; 24 Virgin Australia; DJ; 24 WestJet; WS; 24
custom.steps: 1. Given I have booked a flight with one of the airlines in the preconditions field above, when it is X hours (X is defined by each airline, typically 24 hours) prior to my flight 2. Given I have booked a flight with one of the airlines which is NOT in the preconditions above, when it is 24 hours before the flight departs 3. If I dismiss the notification from inside or outside the Expedia app 4. If I tap [view] on the notification from inside or outside the Expedia app
custom.expected: 1. I should receive a notification that reads “You can now check in for your <carrier name> flight to Chicago.” (ex: “You can now check in for your Virgin America flight to Chicago.”) 2. I should receive a notification that reads “Your <carrier name> flight to Chicago departs in 24 hours.” (ex: “Your Virgin America flight to Chicago departs in 24 hours.”) 2. The notification dismisses 3. I am taken into the Itineraries screen to the relevant Flight card which expands so I can see the details.

section.name: Itineraries Push Notifications
section.description: Flight push notifications require the device to have registered with our push server for a push token and the user has granted us the right to send them. User must either log into an account which has flights or ingest a shared flight itinerary. To check whether device has a push token, go to EB app-> Settings -> App Support -> Email - the email generated will contain the push token status and string.

case.title: Itineraries > Verify native itinerary Flight push notification fires when flight is 2 hours from departure

custom.preconds: User must have booked a flight either as a guest or as a logged-in user, itinerary must be loaded on the device in the trips screen, device must be registered for a push token with the push server. Production flights are more reliable sources of push notifications as they do not get auto-cancelled. Push can be tested with alpha/beta or releasebeta build. To check whether device is registered with an alpha or beta build, insert your own push token into this URL: ewetest-int.flightalerts.mobiata.com/lookup_registration/apns/ExpediaBookingsBeta/<pushtoken>?auth=7Y9pygPntMKAiXK ex: ewetest-int.flightalerts.mobiata.com/lookup_registration/apns/ExpediaBookingsBeta/39c7fcd6fe91ee2e16f0be6ba54d8028ebb89359e1dbb689cc15b4ce5cdaa500?auth=7Y9pygPntMKAiXK
custom.steps: 1. Given I have a flight itinerary in progress, when it is 2 hours before my flight departs 2. If I dismiss the notification from inside or outside the Expedia app 3. If I tap [view] on the notification from inside or outside the Expedia app
custom.expected: 1. I should receive a notification which reads "Your flight to <destination name> departs in 2 hours" (ex: "Your flight to Chicago departs in 2 hours") 2. The notification dismisses 3. I am taken into the Itineraries screen to the relevant Flight card which expands so I can see the details.

case.title: Itineraries > Verify native itinerary Flight push notification fires when flight has a gate change

custom.preconds: User must have booked a flight either as a guest or as a logged-in user, itinerary must be loaded on the device in the trips screen.
custom.steps: 1. Given I have a flight in progress, if there is a gate change when the flight becomes active 2. If I dismiss the notification from inside or outside the Expedia app 3. If I tap [view] on the notification from inside or outside the Expedia app
custom.expected: 1. I should receive a notification that reads “Your flight to <destination city> now departs from <gate id>" (ex: "Your flight to San Francisco now departs from gate 56") 2. The notification dismisses 3. I am taken into the Itineraries screen to the relevant Flight card which expands so I can see the details.

case.title: Itineraries > Verify native itinerary Flight push notification fires when flight has a departure time change

custom.preconds: User must have booked a flight either as a guest or as a logged-in user, itinerary must be loaded on the device in the trips screen.
custom.steps: 1. Given I have a flight in progress, if there is a departure time change when the flight becomes active 2. If I dismiss the notification from inside or outside the Expedia app 3. If I tap [view] on the notification from inside or outside the Expedia app
custom.expected: 1. I should receive a notification that reads “Your flight to <destination city> is delayed <X minutes/hours>" (ex: "Your flight to San Francisco is delayed 25m") 2. The notification dismisses 3. I am taken into the Itineraries screen to the relevant Flight card which expands so I can see the details.

case.title: Itineraries > Verify native itinerary Flight push notification fires when flight has a gate and departure time change

custom.preconds: User must have booked a flight either as a guest or as a logged-in user, itinerary must be loaded on the device in the trips screen.
custom.steps: 1. Given I have a flight in progress, if there is a departure time change and gate change when the flight becomes active 2. If I dismiss the notification from inside or outside the Expedia app 3. If I tap [view] on the notification from inside or outside the Expedia app
custom.expected: 1. I should receive a notification that reads “Your flight to <destination city> will depart at <time> from <gate id>" (ex: "Your flight to San Francisco will depart at 2:50pm from Gate B2") 2. The notification dismisses 3. I am taken into the Itineraries screen to the relevant Flight card which expands so I can see the details.

case.title: Itineraries > Verify native itinerary Flight push notification fires when the flight has been canceled

custom.preconds: User must have booked a flight either as a guest or as a logged-in user, itinerary must be loaded on the device in the trips screen.
custom.steps: 1. Given I have a flight in progress, if the flight has been cancelled 2. If I dismiss the notification from inside or outside the Expedia app 3. If I tap [view] on the notification from inside or outside the Expedia app
custom.expected: 1. I should receive a notification that reads “Your flight to <destination city> is canceled" (ex: "Your flight to San Francisco is canceled") 2. The notification dismisses 3. I am taken into the Itineraries screen to the relevant Flight card which expands so I can see the details.

case.title: Itineraries > Verify native itinerary Flight push notification fires for baggage claim info

custom.preconds: User must have booked a flight either as a guest or as a logged-in user, itinerary must be loaded on the device in the trips screen. There is currently a bug in this feature (as of 6.5), which will display the push as "Your bags will be at baggage claim ."
custom.steps: 1. Given I have a flight in progress, if we receive baggage claim data from the feed 2. If I dismiss the notification from inside or outside the Expedia app 3. If I tap [view] on the notification from inside or outside the Expedia app
custom.expected: 1. I should receive a notification that reads “Your bags will be at baggage claim <carousel id>" (ex: "Your bags will be at baggage claim 13") 2. The notification dismisses 3.
